component.description: Yes, I consent
No, I do not consent
Supervisor behaviors that demonstrate a subordinate is values and their experiences are being considered by leadership
Supervisor behaviors that elicit positive emotions in subordinates to take their mind off of the difficulties of work and life stress
Supervisor behaviors that provide specific resources to the unit to increase well-being by enabling people to be more engaged at work
Supervisor behaviors that increase a subordinates ability to manage their emotions

component.description: Actions that show how you are taking care of your own work/life balance and sleep challenges
Behaviors that demonstrate leadership competence which inspire subordinates to aspire to leadership roles themselves
Behaviors that are intended to inspire subordinates to live healthier lives themselves by working hard, sleeping when able and taking care of family matters when possible
Organizing your work in a way which benefits both your unit and your squad
Actions that point subordinates to tools that will help them in managing their work life balance and sleep habits
Providing support by carefully monitoring subordinate behaviors at work and providing assistance at critical moments
Think about the department as a whole and its relationship with other departments when planning how to get shared goals accomplished
Diagnosing subordinate problems and then providing helpful feedback on how to overcome them
Tailoring work in such a way that benefits both the workplace and subordinates
Reorganizing work flow to improve efficiency without investing more resources into the workplace
Utilizing resources in way that benefits the unit and supports the mission
Asking subordinates how to restructure their work so they can be more productive

activity.description: Giving subordinates control of the work-life means:

activity.name: Giving subordinates control of the work-life means:
activity.description: Giving subordinates control of the work-life means:

component.description: Always allowing them to choose when, how, and where to get tasks done
Designating them as supervisors so they can decide who does what
Finding even small ways in which employees can feel control over their work-life
Giving employees freedom to do any job they want

component.description: Giving employees instructions to care for everyone in their unit’s emotional health
Actively advocating the principles of control and concern
Participating in outside work activities that teach principles of persuasion
Calling the highest managers to convince them of new rules that will change the climate

component.description: People have less stress because the conflict indicates they are doing a lot for their family and workplace
People have poorer health and well-being outcomes such as poor sleep health
People typically win awards in the workplace because they are investing so much
Nothing, work should always conflict with family life.
